title: French (1771) Ostervald Old Testament
description:
French (1771) Ostervald Old Testament The 1771 Ostervald Bible, a Protestant edition, includes the Old and New Testaments, revised and corrected on the original text by pastors and professors of the Church of Geneva. It features chapter arguments and reflections authored by J. F. Ostervald, Pastor of the Church of Neuchâtel. This edition, marked as the third revised and corrected version, was published in Bienne by the Heilmann Library, and in Neuchâtel by S. Fauche & Company.

Ostervald's work is noted for its clarity and insightful commentary, making it a valuable resource for both religious studies and personal edification. Its publication reflects the ongoing efforts of Protestant scholars to provide accessible and accurate translations of biblical texts during this period. The Ostervald Bible holds significance in the history of French Protestantism and biblical scholarship.
